sub_title: Somatic Movement Expert, Educator & Therapist | International Trainer & Speaker | Holistic Health | Body-Mind Therapies
summary:
Patricia Bardi is an educator, dance/voice artist, bodywork specialist, registered somatic movement therapist/educator (ISMETA), licensed natural health practitioner (BATC) originally from New York and currently based in Amsterdam. She is the creator/director of the VMI Somatic Practice Certification Program in Vocal Dance, Voice Movement Integration & Vital Movement Integration Bodywork centered in Amsterdam. The program is accredited as a registered somatic movement therapist/educator by ISMETA – International Somatic Movement Education & Therapy Association and a licensed natural health practitioner for health insurance coverage by KTNO.
 
She has developed & teaches Organ Rebalancing -an advanced natural health practitioner training for professional healthcare practitioner and manual therapists at numerous holistic health institutes including Dr. Rudolf Merkel M.D.'s Cranial Sacral Osteopathy Institute in Zurich. Organ Rebalancing is accredited by the KTNO as a post graduate continuing education training by LVNG, VBAG and BATC.

She has toured extensively throughout Europe and the USA and maintains a private practice working with children and adults.  She is a founding member and teacher/practitioner of the School for Body-Mind Centering (USA), a Registered Somatic Movement Therapist (ISMETA) and a licensed natural health practitioner (BATC).

In 1987, she founded the Rocca Project an annual summer program for interdisciplinary performance arts and healing practice in Tuscany, Italy. She has been on the faculty of NYU’s Department of Experimental Theater and the School for New Dance Development, Amsterdam.

She has presented her research on her somatic approach to breath, voice & movement integration at the first Body, Brain and Cognition Conference at Oxford University, London’s Royal Central School of Speech & Drama, VASTA International Conference, CHASE Symposium at East 15 Acting School and the Netherlands National Center of Performing Arts.

profile_positions.description:
PATRICIA BARDI is a dance/voice artist, an educator, bodywork specialist, a licensed natural health practitioner (BATC) and registered somatic movement therapist (ISMETA) originally from New York & currently based in Amsterdam. For over 20 years, she maintains a private practice with health insurance coverage in Vital Movement Integration (VMI) Bodywork & Organ Rebalancing working with children and adults in Amsterdam.  

 Patricia has toured extensively, teaching and performing at international festivals, universities and theatre schools throughout Europe, North America and India. She has received a London Arts Choreographer Award and conducted research on North Indian vocal music in India. She is a founding member of the School for Body-Mind Centering (USA) and London’s Chisenhale Dance Space. 

Patricia is the creator/director of the VMI Somatic Certification Program, an accredited professional training by ISMETA (International Somatic Movement Education & Therapy Association) & BATC that she founded over 20 years ago, and centred in Amsterdam.  For 22 years, she conducts the Rocca Project, an annual summer program in Tuscany, Italy for interdisciplinary performance practice & healing arts.

She has developed and taught Organ Rebalancing, an accredited postgraduate advanced practitioner training by KTNO for professional health care practitioners & manual therapists, at numerous holistic health institutes including Dr. Rudolf Merkel M.D.’s School for Cranial Sacral Osteopathy in Zurich.

In 2011 she founded the VMI Center, Amsterdam - a center for embodied knowledge through the  practice of voice, movement & touch.

profile_positions.company: VMI Somatic Practice in Vocal Dance, Voice Movement Integration,Vital Movement Integration Bodywork
profile_positions.description:
The VMI Somatic Practice Certification Program includes - Vocal Dance, Voice Movement Integration, Vital Movement Integration Bodywork & Organ Rebalancing. The training develops skills connecting dance, movement, voice, improvisation, bodywork and physical re-patterning education. It is accredited as registered somatic movement therapist/educator by ISMETA &  licensed natural health practitioner by KTNO for health insurance coverage.  
               
     The VMI Somatic Practice training incorporates Patricia Bardi’s innovative original work in Vocal Dance, a creative practice which frees the voice to be fully alive and reflected in one's expressive vitality & movement, Voice Movement Integration a somatic practice combing voice and movement to stimulate and organize the body’s physical-perceptual-emotional awareness & Vital Movement Integration Bodywork a gentle, precise hands-on integrative approach to health & healing. It connects body, mind & emotions bringing a renewed sense of equilibrium & well being through the entire body. VMI Bodywork has a specialization in Organ Rebalancing. 

She has developed and teaches Organ Rebalancing, an accredited postgraduate advanced practitioner training (KTNO) for professional healthcare practitioners & manual therapists at numerous holistic health institutes, including Dr. Rudolf Merkel, MD’s, School for Cranial Sacral Osteopathy in Zurich. 

Patricia has toured extensively teaching & performing. She has collaborated with many dancers, actors, musicians, and poets. Collaborations include Tangle a Vocal Dance and Music performance with Alex Maguire, pianist, Coalescence a Voice and Movement performance with Makoto Matsushima, a principal performer with an internationally acclaimed dance theater company from Tokyo & Felicity Provan -Music & Dance Series at the Bimhuis, Amsterdam.

For over 22 years she has conducted the Rocca Project, an annual summer program in Tuscany for interdisciplinary performance art and healing arts.
